meanings: [명사] reorganization; (특히 정부 조직의) reshuffle, [동사] reorganize, reshuffle; (병력 등을) regroup

meanings.meaning: a soldier re-enlisted in the Army

vlive.korean: 요즘 권력재편 시기 같아요. I think it's a power struggle. 듣기 View video V Animal Family : [해피빈펀딩] 배다해와 알아보는 길고양이와 함께 살아가는 법 #BaeDaHae #HappyBean #Cat
vlive.english: I think it's a power struggle.

examples.korean: The system is reorganized bimodally. 발음듣기 이 시스템은 이원화되게 재편되었다. 국제영어대학원대학교 신어사전
examples.english: The system is reorganized bimodally. 발음

examples.korean: He reorganized the outfit into a stronger competitor. 발음듣기 그는 회사를 강력한 경쟁 체제로 재편했다. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He reorganized the outfit into a stronger competitor. 발음

examples.korean: The US is working to reshuffle the American troops stationed abroad. 발음듣기 미국은 해외 주둔 미군의 재편을 추진하고 있다 Neungyule
examples.english: The US is working to reshuffle the American troops stationed abroad. 발음

examples.korean: In this global age, we need to bring the industrial structure up to date by making necessary changes. 발음듣기 세계화 시대에 맞추어 산업 구조의 재편이 필요하다 Neungyule
examples.english: In this global age, we need to bring the industrial structure up to date by making necessary changes. 발음

examples.korean: With the launch of the new government, the reorganization of the administrative system[structure] is now under discussion. 발음듣기 새 정부 출범에 따라 행정조직의 재편이 논의되고 있다 Neungyule
examples.english: With the launch of the new government, the reorganization of the administrative system[structure] is now under discussion. 발음
